verbs.description: immerge (third-person singular simple present immerges, present participle immerging, simple past and past participle immerged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To plunge into, under, or within anything, especially a fluid; to dip; to immerse.
examples: We took  […]  lukewarm water, and in it immerged a quantity of the leaves of senna.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To disappear by entering into any medium, as a star into the light of the sun.
